April 30, 1894. 

                        Idleness. 


     "Not slothful in business; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord." There is but one remedy for indolence, and that is to throw off sluggishness as a sin that leads to perdition, and go to work, using the physical ability that God has given you for this purpose. The only cure for a useless, inefficient life, is effort, determined, persevering effort. The only cure for selfishness is to deny self, 


                         - 9 - 

and work earnestly to be the blessing that you can be to your fellow-men. "He that observeth the wind shall not sow; and he that regardeth the clouds shall not reap."
